Fields.DialogueText: Captain, Morganas are surrounding us on all sides.
I got that from the alarm. Where's McDougal? She's usually first on the bridge when the shooting's about to start.
She's the one who told us. You saw how quickly they came on - if it wasn't for her we would've been caught completely unawares.
There's no time to waste. Get everyone in position and let's make sure we see tomorrow.
@BATTLE
That was... not nearly as fun as it should've been.
What's going on? How are the Morganas catching us with our pants down?
Did you say something? My ears are still ringing.

Fields.MenuText: Who do I have to reprimand to make sure this never happens again?
Are the Morganas getting stronger? Or sneakier, at least?
Don't make me repeat myself, McDougal. This is serious.

Fields.DialogueText: It wasn't anyone's fault, all right? I should've seen them coming from a mile away, I don't know how I didn't.
I wouldn't say stronger. We're still standing. Sneakier, however... maybe they've got something up their sleeves.
Hey, calm down. I don't know how they're doing it, but I'm going to be doing my best to make sure it doesn't happen again.
Maybe we should make port for now. Make sure we're at least ready for the next time.
If there's a next time. This is only the second time, right?
Better safe than dead.
Hey, McDougal. Could I ask a favor?
I mean, if it's absolutely necessary.
Could you keep an eye on what we take on board again? You did a fine job last time.
I dunno. Maybe if you ask extra-nicely....

Fields.MenuText: Please, will you do me this favor?
Never mind, not worth it. I’ll do it.
On second thought, you probably shouldn’t. You’ll stop as soon as you see the pie.

Fields.DialogueText: Pfbt. Captain, there's no need to beg.
Oh, come on! Fine, fine, fine. You got me.
Pie, you say? You can count me in.
I've got nothing better to do, anyway.
Thank you, McDougal. It's appreciated.
If you really want to thank me, maybe think about getting me a shiny new gun to bloody up.
Captain, there are reports of a group of Morganas nearby.
How close? Do we have time to resupply?
We should. They don’t seem to be heading our way. I just figured McDougal might want to take care of them.
You’re probably right. Looks like we have our next destination.
@BATTLE
McDougal, what are you doing?
I’m watching out for Morganas. Making sure we aren’t surprised again. I thought that’s what you wanted.
I thought you sensed them. I didn’t think sight was actually a factor.
You have a problem with my process?

Fields.MenuText: You know, if you lean too far, you’ll fall over the edge of the bow.
Not if it gets results. Have you gotten any results?
I’ve never noticed before, but you have lovely eyes.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Cap, I can swim. And levitate, and walk through walls, and shoot death rays out of my eyes when I'm hungry. A little water won't hurt me.
Have we been attacked?
W-what? My eyes? ... What a stupid thing to say.
I get the picture.
I really want to see those death rays sometime, by the way.
Wait until lunchtime and see what kind of lines we've got in the mess.
No.
There's your answer.
It’s just a compliment. I didn’t mean to upset you.
Who’s upset? I’m not upset. I barely even heard what you said.
Still, if I crossed a line...
Don't be stupid. I told you I...
Stop the presses! A small group is coming up from behind us.
I guess your process works after all.
Don’t forget it.
@BATTLE
I assume you're not just here because you like my company...
Hey, I like your company just fine. It's only that...
No, no. You knocked on my door - that's not what you do on a casual visit. Let me guess. Something's on fire?
No. No, you want something.
Listen, I have a small request, puny even - you’ll hardly notice it.

Fields.MenuText: Knowing you, I assume it’s something related to fighting Morganas.
If it’s that small, it shouldn’t be an issue.
Sounds too good to be true, coming from you.

Fields.DialogueText: I’m starting to think you might know me a little too well...
Well, it might be just a tad larger than advertised, but still pretty tiny.
Should I even bother sugar coating it for you?
Probably not.
Hmmmm...
What is it, McDougal?
There’s a really big Morgana to the east. Can I go kill her and her friends?
I suppose I should be glad you’re asking me rather than just taking us straight to it.
Well, I know how much trust means to you. You can trust me to tell you when I’m sensing Morganas, and I hope you can trust me to blow ‘em up.
Please, stop playing with Mr. Contingency-Plan.
Oh, sorry, habit.
So are we good to change course?
I know better than to try and say no.
You’re so smart, Captain. It’s amazing.
You can stop greasing the wheels. You already got what you wanted.
Good point!
@BATTLE
Hey, McDougal.
Do you have a minute?
Ugh. Sure, but...
I know what you're gonna say, Cap, so let me just start with "I'm sorry."

Fields.MenuText: So am I. We blundered into that battle before we were ready. We’re lucky you’re still seaworthy.
For what? That last engagement? Come on, that battle had all the explosions you could’ve wanted.
Our difficulties during that battle were as much my fault as they were yours. At least we made it out of there alive.

Fields.DialogueText: You’re right. I underestimated our opponent. It won’t happen again.
Hey, the only kind of explosions I like are on the enemy ship. They’re not nearly as fun when they’re on your own deck.
Why do you keep doing that?
Doing what?
Being nice to me. Stop it. Especially when I mess up.
... Sorry?
At the very least, we can say we won. We might’ve taken a beating, but the other guy is doing a lot worse.
The Morganas are getting worse and worse. They’re sneaking up on us, they’re overpowering us...
Sounds like we need a new weapon under out belt.
A new weapon... or maybe new allies...
Allies? Captain, you don’t need anyone else. You’ve got me!
Yeah, and look how far that’s gotten us.
Can we just take a second and think about this?
Doesn’t sound like it. Let’s hope we can fend these Morganas off without anymore damage to our hull.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All right, that ought to do it.
Spread this message to all our contacts. Hopefully they can get the word out and we’ll have something to act on soon.
Yes, Captain. Right away.

Fields.MenuText: The faster that message gets out, the better.
Thank goodness that’s taken care of.

Fields.DialogueText: So she was obviously hiding something... anything I should know about?
Whoa, where’s the fire? That officer nearly ran me over!
What was that? You having secret meetings without me now?
It's nothing for now. I'll loop you in if anything develops.
You'd better. I'll remember if you don't.
That's my fault. I told him to run. You're not hurt, are you?
Of course I’m not hurt. He was just a puny man. I’m a Belle. It’s gonna take more than that.
... Well, if I invited everyone it wouldn't be much of a secret, now would it?
I don't really like secrets. So if you wanna stay on my good side, you should start looping me in.
Oh, right, I wanted to let you know the hull’s repair is shaping up. We should be good as new soon.
That was fast.
Let’s just say I know how to motivate people to get the lead outta their asses.
Yeah, I feel comfortable leaving it at that. Just let me know when we’re patched up.
You got it, Cap.
*ALARM*
Damn it!
Are we in fighting shape?
Better'n we were, and that'll have to be as good as new!
@BATTLE
Captain?
Zzzzzzzz....
Poke!
Captain, you ready to celebrate?

Fields.MenuText: I'm awake, I'm awake!
Oh, McDougal, thank God you woke me up. I was just having the worst nightmare.
Ugggh, shhh, I'm already celebrating in my dream.

Fields.DialogueText: Seriously, Captain, sleeping on the job?
Oh, yeah? What was it about? Tiger men from Mars, or everyone's a clown?
... I've got a feeling I don't want to know how dream-you celebrates.
I had some free time, and I took advantage of it. I hardly get to take naps anymore.
Actually it was the one where you and Mr. Contingency-Plan switch places. He keeps threatening to use you if he doesn't get his way.
Heh. Yeah, that sounds like him. What a character.
I've got a feeling I don't want to tell you. Now if you'd please, I'd like to finish my dream.
Well, back here in the real world -- you know, the world afflicted with Morganas -- it’s time to test out our repairs.
The hull is finished?
Ding-ding-ding, give our contestant a prize!
And I’m guessing you want us to find a Morgana for this test?
Okay, now you’re just cheating.
How are we on supplies?
Adequately stocked and ready to rumble.
Then I have no reason to say no.
Captain’s on board, people! Let’s get this ship moving!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hey, Captain - you almost missed the fun!
Though if you ever want me to take over again....
Do you want to?
Hell, no. I don't miss the paperwork at all.
Heh.
@BATTLE
Oh, yes! We’re unbeatable. There’s not a Morgana around that can take on the great McDougal!
McDougal, get down from there.
Yeah, you heard me, Morgana! All of you! I could defeat you all with one hand tied behind my back!
You’re causing a scene. We’ve already won.
Oh, come on, Captain, you know you want to gloat a little too. I mean, we just took down some of the baddest of the bad. They didn’t know who they were messing with!

Fields.MenuText: ... All right, fine, move over.
Gloating has never done anyone any good.
Not even a little. Now get down.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I knew I'd bring you around!
I beg to differ. It’s doing me a world of good right now.
You’re such a party killer, you know that?
You have to admit, though, it felt great showing them a thing or two.
Yeah, especially after taking that huge hit. Not only to the ship, but to our egos.
And to think, we were worried they were getting stronger.
I still am. You’re acting like that was easy. We broke more than a sweat.
Was the poor widdle captain scared?
No! You know what I mean.
I’m just not worried. I mean, look at me. Look at how awesome I am.
All that fighting made me hungry. I’m gonna go get a slice of pie. I’d invite you along, but then there’d be less pie for me.
At least she’s confident.
Hey, Cappy, grabbing lunch?
Yeah, and it looks like the rest of the ship is too. I can’t find a seat anywhere.
Oh, I gotcha. Gimme a second.
Hey, you two. Get on up and outta here.
Excuse me?
Oh, I’m sorry, did I stutter? LEAVE.
You can’t just make us leave. Where do you want us to eat? The hallway?
I don’t care where you go, you’re just not staying here.
Make us.
I’m sorry, did you say something? I was too busy reloading my many, many guns to hear you. Could you repeat that?
Uh, the seats are yours.
That’s what I thought you said.
Captain, over here. Two seats just opened up.

Fields.MenuText: Ah, yes, the classic McDougal Diplomacy.
I could’ve just eaten on the deck. You didn’t need to threaten anyone.
I suppose I should be happy you didn’t actually shoot them.

Fields.DialogueText: Don’t be sarcastic. I can be diplomatic when I want to be.
What are you talking about? Threatening, pshaw. If you want to see a threat, I can show you a threat.
Please, I wouldn’t waste ammo on friendly fire. Each of my shells has a Morgana’s name on it.
*ALARM*
Looks like you better eat fast. Fun’s knocking on our door.
@BATTLE
McDougal?
What's up? You look... antsy.
Anything I can help with?
No, I'm not... I mean, it's okay.
I just hate having to waste more time at port, y'know?

Fields.MenuText: It’s just a short stop. We’ll be back on the seas blasting Morganas before you know it.
I know. But it's better to be safe than sorry at least once in a while. Keeps us from becoming predictable.
We’ll stop when I decide it’s necessary. Do you have a problem with that?

Fields.DialogueText: We better be. I guess while we’re here I might as well take a break.
Heh. Okay.
Fine, be that way.
I’ll be in my quarters if you need me.
Captain, we’ve received a transmission.
Is it from someone we know?
No. They say they heard about your problem from your friend in New York, and that they think they have what you’re looking for.
Well, that all sounds a little illicit.
They were rather vague. Would you prefer we ignore the transmission?
I’m not sure. I’ll read it over and make a decision soon.
*ALARM*
Looks like my reading will have to wait. Go get McDougal from her quarters.
I’m pretty sure she’s already on deck after hearing the alarm.
You’re probably right.
@BATTLE
McDougal, can I come in? I need to talk to you.
Captain, come in. I’ll get us something to drink.
I’m glad to see you’re in a good mood.
I’m always in a good mood.
We both know that’s not true.
Did you say something... Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing important.
You know you can be cranky, McDougal. Don’t act like this is news.
Nice try, but I’ve gotten used to that glare of yours.

Fields.DialogueText: Glad to hear it.
That's not a nice thing to tell your host.
You shouldn't think that I'm out of tricks up my sleeve.
*CRASH*
Watch where you're throwing things. You almost hit my face.
I'll aim better next time.
Good. I expect perfection from you, y'know.
Heh.
*BANG*
... Did you just throw that cup in the air and shoot it?
Maybe...
Was that one of the expensive ones?
... Don't rub it in.
Anyway, getting back to what I came here for...
Oh, right. Did you need my help?
Sort of. See... I’ve been exploring the prospect of getting some heavy industry players to look you over.
See if we can try integrating some different thinking about weapons and armor into your loadout.
I assume this idea was brought to mind as a result of the hole blown open in my side.
You assume correctly. And recently I received word from someone who seems to think they can help us.
You don’t sound so sure.
It sounds a little sketchy. I’m not sure how trustworthy this guy is.
Trust again? I’m starting to think you might be the one with trust issues, Cap.
So you think we should meet the man?
I will always say yes if there’s a chance for shiny new weapons.
That biggest smile I’ve ever seen on your face.
You got a problem with my smile?
Certainly not. I should talk about guns more often.
You make it sound like I only smile about guns. There is a wide range of things that make me happy.
*ALARM*
Does that wide range include defeating Morganas?
You know it.
@BATTLE
How come we’re not moving? I thought we had some meeting to get to.
We have some time left. I figured you might want to get one last fight in before we head west.
One last fight?
Well, if all goes as planned, the installation of your new weapons will likely require you to be in dry dock for a while.
Ugh, I never even thought about that. We’d better find a big Morgana to go out on, then!
Lead the way.
@BATTLE
Okay, everyone knows what to do.
McDougal? Still with me?
Grr...
... That was a good idea, Cap.

Fields.MenuText: I have those every once in a while.
What did you just say? Can Belles get concussions?
You think anything involving fighting Morganas is a good idea.

Fields.DialogueText: They’re rare, but worth the wait in between ‘em.
Shut up. And... I actually don’t know.
True. So it probably wasn’t actually that good of an idea.
I think I’m good to sit in dry dock for a while, but only if it’s absolutely necessary.
Well, it’s not necessary yet. We’re still a ways off.
I hear you loud and clear, Captain. I’ll shut up and continue punching.
Not what I meant, but whatever makes you happy.
Aren’t we there yet? I remember New York being a lot closer than this.
We’re almost there. No need to get worked up.
Do I look like I’m worked up? Worked up for me involves a whole lot more yelling and cursing.

Fields.MenuText: You’re right, my mistake. If you were worked up, you would be cursing more.
I’ve found there are varying levels to your anger. At this point, you’re at a five or six.
If you’re not worked up then prove it by being polite and cordial with our guests.

Fields.DialogueText: I might also be shooting and, on rare occasions, blowing stuff up.
Hmmmm. That’s not a bad way of looking at it. I do feel like I’m at a five right now.
Hey, I’ll be whatever I damn well want to be. And I haven’t decided what that is yet.
Captain, our destination is coming over the horizon.
Great. Hear that, McDougal? We’re almost there.
Woooo!
*BOOM*
What was that? Artillery fire?
I’m sensing Morganas! And they’re close.
There’s a group of them within firing range as we speak.
Well, what are you waiting for? Fire already!
How did we miss them?
I don’t know! We’ll worry about it later. We’ve got bigger fish to fry right now.
@BATTLE
That shouldn’t have happened.
They came out of nowhere. One second we’re fine and the next we’re getting attacked.
We need to make port as soon as possible.

Fields.MenuText: Now who’s pissing themselves?
If I didn’t know any better, I’d say you were scared.
I already know that. We’re moving as fast as we can.

Fields.DialogueText: If you want to start a fight, I’m more than willing, but I’d prefer we go to port and not sink to the ocean floor.
I’m not scared. This is just a reminder of how badly we could use some new weaponry.
Well, we gotta move faster. Unload some cargo or kick it into a higher gear or something.
We’ll get there, okay? And then we can talk to this guy. Maybe he knows something we don’t.
You can handle the talking. I’ll handle the weapons.
You’ve got to put some work in if you want the rewards.
Are you saying you want my help? Talking? Me? Seriously?
*ALARM*
Yeah, but first I’d like your help fighting some more Morganas off.
I guess we didn’t finish them all off.
Let’s make sure we don’t make the same mistake this time.
I don’t know about you, but I learn from my mistakes.
@BATTLE
So, you’re the man who thinks he’s "got what we’re looking for," huh?
Call me Max. And, yeah, I’ve got a few things for sale, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'm no hero. I'm just somebody with a job to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Mmhmm. Well, from what I’ve heard, it would seem the Morganas keep catching you unawares like, right?
Yeah. They seem to pop up out of nowhere.
Then I have exactly what you’re looking for, my friend. When we’re done here, Morganas won’t be half as scary as they look.
This the guy?
Who is this enchanting vision?
I don’t give my name out to every sleazeball who asks for it.
This is Max.

Fields.MenuText: Our new friend.
This is the guy who can get us your shiny new toys.
I don’t trust him yet.

Fields.DialogueText: I don’t make friends that easily.
We better make sure they didn’t fall off a truck first.
With a face like that, I don’t blame you.
I’m standing right here, you know.
Yeah, we see you. Does it bother you?
As long as I get my money, you can spit on my face and I’ll smile while you do it.
Yeah... I definitely don’t trust you.
I don’t trust you either. Doesn’t mean we can’t still make a deal.
I’m starting to rethink this whole thing.
Hey, hey, hey, no need to...
*ALARM*
Is that the alarm? Or are my ears still ringing from your beauty?
That question made no sense, creep. And what are the Morganas doing, attacking us at such a secure port?
You didn’t know? The Morganas have started getting ballsy. They shoot at whatever ship they see, secure port or not.
Well, it looks like you’re coming with us for a ride, Max. Try not to... get in the way.
@BATTLE
Never figured the Neutrality Fleet would send its big ol' hero out scrounging for parts from the likes of me, mind.

Fields.MenuText: You and me both.
As long as the parts are good, I'm fine with it.

Fields.DialogueText: McDougal? What are you doing down here? Max is waiting to talk to us upstairs. He says he won’t start without you there.
Ugh. He said that, really?
Specifically, he said he didn’t want to start without "that smokin’ leggy blonde babe from before."
Gross.
Yeah, I know he’s sleazy. But we made it all the way here, so we might as well hear him out.
Fine. I suppose we’re only in America because of him. I was starting to miss home.
Not a fan of the rest of the world?
Europe, Asia, Africa... they’re nothing compared to the U.S. of A.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I can admit I’m a pretty big fan of America myself.
There’s a lot to appreciate in other countries, you know?
Have you traveled enough to decide that?

Fields.DialogueText: Not as big as me.
That hasn’t been my experience.
I've picked up my share of Japanese and Spanish from the Pacific and Caribbean. It's all right, but I know what I really like.
Noooo, not by far.
We can talk about your... preconceptions later. Right now, I need your help with Max.
Fine, if only to get my new toys faster. And him off my ship.
That’s the spirit.
Just promise we can take a break sometime soon to fight more Morganas. I’m not sure how long I can take him ogling me.
Me neither...
Oh, really? Is this a new side to you, Captain?
Protective?
I was going to say jealous.
Of Max? Doubtful.
Mmhmm... sure.
McDougal...
*ALARM*
Let’s table this discussion for later. We’re needed upstairs.
Killjoy.
@BATTLE
Okay, so I’ve checked around the ship, scoped out your equipments and whatnots, and I think I’ve got exactly what you need.
And that would be?
I’ve spent some time collecting refuse from a few fights with the Morganas. When they started shooting up the port, it made my mission even easier.
Through a little ingenuity and engineering, I’ve managed to create a Morgana superweapon.
You mean we’d have a Morgana’s gun on our ship?

Fields.MenuText: Are your eyes sparkling?
Sounds like it could be useful.
How would that help us with detecting them?

Fields.DialogueText: Can you blame me? This sounds more enticing than apple pie.
Sounds like it could be fun!
He asks a good question.
How would a gun keep the Morganas from surprising us?
This particular weapon has an interesting mechanic. It automatically fires at its nearest enemy.
We wouldn’t need to detect them. The gun would shoot at them for us!
You got it exactly, my dear.
Honestly, that sounds a little too good to be true.
Well, if you don’t believe me, I can bring it on board and we can test it. The first firing is free. It’s a Maxxy Guarantee.
Couldn’t hurt to test it out, right, Cap?
I guess a little window shopping wouldn’t hurt.
That’s what I like to hear!
Captain, there’s a small group of Morganas to the south. They’re not heading our way, but McDougal asked...
Perfection! Max, we’ll take care of the Morganas. You focus on that gun of yours.
Don’t get too excited yet, McDougal.
You might as well get the champagne ready. You’re going to love this weapon!
I can’t wait to see it!
Good grief...
@BATTLE
McDougal? Got something to say?
Not really.
Try again.
Well, since you bring it up - why are we still here?

Fields.MenuText: Unless we want to jump overboard, we’re kind of stuck. And you're screwed no matter what you do.
That’s a very esoteric question, and I personally believe there isn’t any one answer...
We’re staying in port while Max finishes preparing the gun.

Fields.DialogueText: You know that’s not what I mean. I mean, why are we still in port?
What? Are you speaking gibberish right now? I mean, why can’t we leave port?
Can’t he do that in the open seas? My sea legs are cramping up.
Trust me. It’s better to make repairs and modifications near land. I’m just being careful here.
Ugh, fine. I’ll go see if I can help him. Maybe speed along this process. I do know my way around guns.
Your technical know-how is pretty impressive.
Feel free to offer up compliments like that whenever you please, Cap.
Yes, ma’am. Oh, and while you’re out there helping, keep an eye out for any Morganas. I’d rather get the first shot on them for a change.
Playing with a new gun and watching for Morganas? If you toss in a shooting range, it’d be the best combination ever!
@BATTLE
Okay, we're nearly ready to go. I just need one more thing to get this baby working.
And that would be?
Choose your requests carefully.
The weapon needs a sample target, so it can identify enemies in the future. So what we need to do is gather a piece of a Morgana to use as a sample.

Fields.MenuText: I thought you said you had plenty of Morgana refuse. Use some of that.
So we need to start a fight with a Morgana?
It needs a sample? How does that even work?

Fields.DialogueText: I used all my pieces making the weapon. We’ll need to find a Morgana.
Exactly. I’m sure McDougal is raring to go, ain’t ya, little darling?
I don’t know how these Morgana weapons work. I just know what gets ‘em going.
Well, McDougal, do you think you can find us something to fight?
Captain, I thought you’d never ask.
@BATTLE
Will this do?
Perfect. This oughta keep the gun charged for a month or so.
I can’t wait to see this baby in action!
Ew.
*BOOM*
Was that... ?
That was the gun! And look at that... a direct hit!
Amazing!
... Let’s get to it.
@BATTLE
That was the greatest thing ever! I’m so happy that I could almost kiss you.
Oh, well, uh...
I said almost for a reason, buddy.
Well then, I’ll just take my money and be on my way.

Fields.MenuText: McDougal seems satisfied with it, so I guess it’s money well spent.
I hate to spend so much money, but it would be a helpful weapon to have around...
I’m not really sure it’s worth it...

Fields.DialogueText: I am very satisfied. I’ve never been so satisfied in my life!
Don’t be so cheap, Captain. Give the man his money.
Fine, I’ll pay him. Give me the briefcase!
It’s been a pleasure doing business with you fine people. Enjoy.
Don’t spend all that money in one place.
That salesman sure can move fast when he’s got arms full of dough.
I still don’t trust him as far as I can throw him.
You saw the gun, though. It worked like a dream! That battle was our easiest since the war started.
I guess I can’t argue with results.
I am feeling all sorts of confident with this new gun on board. I’m ready to take on the world, Cap!
We’re not invincible, McDougal. It’s just one gun. You could still end up with a hole in your hull.
I can be cocky and careful at the same time. I’m a Belle of many talents.
Well, let me ask you this. Are we going to be cocky and run headfirst into danger, or careful and stock up at the nearest port?
What do you think, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: Let’s go straight to port.
Head-first into danger it is.
Do I look like a mind reader?

Fields.DialogueText: Now we both know that’s not what we’re going to do.
That’s why you’re the captain. You know how to keep me happy.
...I’m still not sure. How many fingers am I holding up?
*BOOM*
What the hell is that?
Captain, McDougal, we have Morganas approaching from all sides. They’re opening fire.
Why isn’t the new gun shooting?
We can’t seem to make it work. And... pieces are falling off.
Falling off?
Son of a bitch sold us a lemon! I knew we couldn’t trust that slug.
Forget about the weapon for now. We need to focus on surviving this ambush!
@BATTLE
Two?
... Lucky guess.
Be sure to get more pie. I just ate the last one.
Any specific flavor?
Surprise me... oh, but make sure at least half are apple.
Half?
Did I stutter?
Okay, half it is.

Fields.MenuText: Scaring the crew again, I see.
With all the pie you eat, you should be bigger than the ship.
Get me a few blueberry ones too!

Fields.DialogueText: I’m not scaring anyone. He asked if there was anything I wanted.
If I were, you could all sail on me and I could fight the Morganas in hand to hand combat. Wouldn’t that be fantastic?
Yeah, you heard the captain. Our mighty leader needs blueberries.
Oh, Captain, guess what I was just checking out.

Fields.MenuText: You really shouldn’t check out your superior, McDougal.
Our "shiny new weapon?"
What?

Fields.DialogueText: Don’t be so full of yourself. It’s annoying.
Well, you don’t have to rub it in.
You take the fun out of everything, you know that?
I’m kicking myself that I didn’t inspect the gun sooner. The pieces were held together with glue. Glue! Like generic, casein glue.
I don’t know how it worked before, but it’s useless now.
We were conned. No wonder he ran out of here with the money.
Well... actually, that’s not exactly the case. Or should I say briefcase.
Are you trying to make a pun? What are you talking about?
You took the wrong briefcase when you paid him. He has a case full of American trinkets that the crew bought me at port -- flags and the like. Our money’s right here.
You have all of it? Why didn’t you tell me before?
I only just realized. I was coming to get you when the officer asked me about the pie.
So we still have our money... and no new defenses against the Morganas. Looks like we’re starting from scratch.
Maybe we don’t need to, Cap. Let’s stick to our own weapons for now. Put a little trust in me.
I trust you, McDougal. But we can’t just keep blindly going after every Morgana we see. We have to start strategizing.
A strategy sounds like a good idea to me, Captain. We can get on that as soon as I get my hands on some pie.
@BATTLE
McDougal, I need to talk to you about something.
What’s up?
We talked about strategizing, remember?
Yeah... Oh! Is this a strategy meeting? Where’s the war table and maps and colored pins and stuff?
No, this isn’t anything like that. I just wanted to talk with you about what we’re going to do with all that Morgana debris on deck.
You mean the stuff we got from Max? Can’t we just dump it overboard? That’s where he got it anyway, right?
I just thought it might be worth it if we checked it out ourselves. There could be something valuable in there.
I don’t think it’s worth the time or effort it would take. If there was anything worth anything in that trash, Max wouldn’t have sold it to us in the first place.

Fields.MenuText: You have a point.
You might be right, but I still think we should give it a quick glance, at least.
He was an idiot. He wouldn’t know value if it bit him in the ass.

Fields.DialogueText: I have lots of those. They’re attached to my ideas and my knives.
You’re thinking about this too much. It’s junk!
I can’t argue that. But we’d be idiots if we started sifting through his trash for gold.
If we waste anymore time on this subject than we already have, we’re even bigger idiots than Max. We gotta just let it go.
Okay, let’s at least see if the INPF has any interest in it when we make port.
I think that’s a fair compromise. Look at us, all working together and stuff like mature adults.  We’re great.
*ALARM*
Sounds like it’s time to work together to take down a couple Morganas.
Perfect timing! Let’s smash some heads!
@BATTLE
Enough for a couple pies.
That’s my kind of money.
Hey... you think you’d maybe like to, I don’t know... share a pie?

Fields.MenuText: You’re always either hungry or bloodthirsty. Sure, I could go for a bite.
You’d... share a pie?
T-the two of us? Yeah, of course!

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, don’t make me regret asking.
I can share! Provided I like the company of the person I’m sharing with.
Heh, look at who’s nervous about sharing a pie.
*ALARM*
Now? But... but... pie!
There will be plenty of time for pie after the battle.
There’d better be! And before you do your paperwork -- that always takes forever!
Right after. I promise.
Good.
@BATTLE
I can’t believe the INPF compensated us for all that junk.
Enough for a pie?
I asked some contacts of mine to keep on the lookout for our mutual "friend."
If you’re talking about Max, I’d prefer you only refer to him as a "slug-like scoundrel."
Very well. I asked some contacts of mine to keep on the lookout for our mutual slug-like scoundrel.
Thank you. And?
And someone spotted him. In Mexico.
Well, that’s not far away.
No it is not. What do you say we pay our f--
AHEM.
Excuse me, what do you say we pay our "slug-like scoundrel" a visit?
I’d say, other than destroying Morganas, and having pie with you, there’s little I rather do more than put that man in his place.
On the way, we can plan the perfect means of dealing with him. Stretch your strategizing muscles a little, as it were.
Perfect. When do we leave?
*ALARM*
After this battle?
Sounds perfect to me.
Guess what?
What?
